connector.description: Communicate with external systems using the MLLP protocol.

camel.sink.path.hostname.name: camel.sink.path.hostname
camel.sink.path.hostname.description: Hostname or IP for connection for the TCP connection. The default value is null, which means any local IP address

camel.sink.path.port.name: camel.sink.path.port
camel.sink.path.port.description: Port number for the TCP connection

camel.sink.endpoint.autoAck.name: camel.sink.endpoint.autoAck
camel.sink.endpoint.autoAck.description: Enable/Disable the automatic generation of a MLLP Acknowledgement MLLP Consumers only

camel.sink.endpoint.hl7Headers.name: camel.sink.endpoint.hl7Headers
camel.sink.endpoint.hl7Headers.description: Enable/Disable the automatic generation of message headers from the HL7 Message MLLP Consumers only

camel.sink.endpoint.requireEndOfData.name: camel.sink.endpoint.requireEndOfData
camel.sink.endpoint.requireEndOfData.description: Enable/Disable strict compliance to the MLLP standard. The MLLP standard specifies START_OF_BLOCKhl7 payloadEND_OF_BLOCKEND_OF_DATA, however, some systems do not send the final END_OF_DATA byte. This setting controls whether or not the final END_OF_DATA byte is required or optional.

camel.sink.endpoint.stringPayload.name: camel.sink.endpoint.stringPayload
camel.sink.endpoint.stringPayload.description: Enable/Disable converting the payload to a String. If enabled, HL7 Payloads received from external systems will be validated converted to a String. If the charsetName property is set, that character set will be used for the conversion. If the charsetName property is not set, the value of MSH-18 will be used to determine th appropriate character set. If MSH-18 is not set, then the default ISO-8859-1 character set will be use.

camel.sink.endpoint.validatePayload.name: camel.sink.endpoint.validatePayload
camel.sink.endpoint.validatePayload.description: Enable/Disable the validation of HL7 Payloads If enabled, HL7 Payloads received from external systems will be validated (see Hl7Util.generateInvalidPayloadExceptionMessage for details on the validation). If and invalid payload is detected, a MllpInvalidMessageException (for consumers) or a MllpInvalidAcknowledgementException will be thrown.

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.charsetName.name: camel.sink.endpoint.charsetName
camel.sink.endpoint.charsetName.description: Set the CamelCharsetName property on the exchange

camel.sink.endpoint.receiveBufferSize.name: camel.sink.endpoint.receiveBufferSize
camel.sink.endpoint.receiveBufferSize.description: Sets the SO_RCVBUF option to the specified value (in bytes)

camel.sink.endpoint.sendBufferSize.name: camel.sink.endpoint.sendBufferSize
camel.sink.endpoint.sendBufferSize.description: Sets the SO_SNDBUF option to the specified value (in bytes)

camel.sink.endpoint.connectTimeout.name: camel.sink.endpoint.connectTimeout
camel.sink.endpoint.connectTimeout.description: Timeout (in milliseconds) for establishing for a TCP connection TCP Client only

camel.sink.endpoint.idleTimeout.name: camel.sink.endpoint.idleTimeout
camel.sink.endpoint.idleTimeout.description: The approximate idle time allowed before the Client TCP Connection will be reset. A null value or a value less than or equal to zero will disable the idle timeout.

camel.sink.endpoint.readTimeout.name: camel.sink.endpoint.readTimeout
camel.sink.endpoint.readTimeout.description: The SO_TIMEOUT value (in milliseconds) used after the start of an MLLP frame has been received

camel.sink.endpoint.receiveTimeout.name: camel.sink.endpoint.receiveTimeout
camel.sink.endpoint.receiveTimeout.description: The SO_TIMEOUT value (in milliseconds) used when waiting for the start of an MLLP frame

camel.component.mllp.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.component.mllp.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.mllp.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.mllp.autowiredEnabled.name: camel.component.mllp.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.mllp.autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

camel.component.mllp.defaultCharset.name: camel.component.mllp.defaultCharset
camel.component.mllp.defaultCharset.description: Set the default character set to use for byte to/from String conversions.

camel.component.mllp.logPhi.name: camel.component.mllp.logPhi
camel.component.mllp.logPhi.description: Set the component to log PHI data.

camel.component.mllp.logPhiMaxBytes.name: camel.component.mllp.logPhiMaxBytes
camel.component.mllp.logPhiMaxBytes.description: Set the maximum number of bytes of PHI that will be logged in a log entry.
